intro: Carpotroche brasiliensis var. bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia carpotroche, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
